AmbieSoft ("Ambiesoft," the "Company," "we," "us," and "our,") respect your privacy. We are committed to protecting it through our compliance with this privacy policy.

 Please read this policy carefully to understand our policies and practices regarding your information and how we will treat it. You may optionally provide us with this information through third-party sign-in services such as Google Plus. By using the Services, you consent to the collection, transfer, use, storage and disclosure of your information as described in this Privacy Policy, including to the transfer of your information outside of your country of residence. 
 
 Changes to this privacy policy We reserve the right to amend this Privacy Policy from time to time to reflect changes in the law, our data collection and use practices, the features of our services, or advances in technology. Melbourne is one of the most culture-rich cities in the world with many talented street artists as its iconic symbols. There are a number of street artists in Melbourne, whether they are for music, dance, magic, art performance, poetry, and legal graffiti. However, their activities are not well acknowledged as a potential resource to gain more benefits from their existence by City of Melbourne.

 The Street Artist Finder, ST.ART, is an Android Application that acts as a platform for interactions between buskers and tourists. Buskers can create and manage their portfolio and performance event, with a specific location, date and time. Reputation can be gained as tourists can find the event and its details around the City of Melbourne through the same application, meanwhile giving reviews and scores to the buskers. 
 
 User Instruction 
 
 Create account: 
 Step 1: Open the ST.ART application. 
 Step 2: Click “Register” 
 Step 3: Input e-mail address, password and preferred username 
 Step 4: Click on the Register button 
 
 View all / filter performance: 
 Step 1: Open the ST.ART application. 
 Step 2A: Performance for today are listed by default. Click on the particular performance to get more detailed information: Name, Category, Date, Time, Description. 
 Step 2B: Click the map icon to view the performances in map view. Click the marker on the map and an information window will popup. Click on the information window to view the details of performances: Name, Category, Date, Time, Description. 
 Step 3: Click on the search button on the top right-hand corner on either list or map, to do a filter on the result. Keywords in performance name, category, date and performance after a specific time can be set. Click on the filter button and the result will be filtered. 
 
 Switch show/hide artwork. 
 Step 1: Open the ST.ART application. 
 Step 2: Go to map view. 
 Step 4: Click more icon on the top right corner 
 Step 5: Select ‘Show artworks’. 
 Step 6: Click the marker to view the name of the artwork, and click the info window for more detail. 
 Step 7: If the user does not want to view artworks, select ‘Hide artworks’. 
 
 Create performance: 
 Step 1: Open the ST.ART application. 
 Step 2: Sign in as registered user 
 Step 2: Click the New Busking icon 
 Step 3: Enter the name of the performance. 
 Step 4: Choose the category of performance. 
 Step 5: Enter the performance description. 
 Step 6: Choose a date to perform. 
 Step 7: Choose a specific start time of performance. 
 Step 8: Choose a duration of performance. 
 Step 9: Choose a location on the map and click ‘Select this location’. 
 Step 10: Confirm the selection and create the performance. 
 Step 11: Performance will be created and saved onto the database, if all inputs are valid. 
 
 Edit performance: 
 Step 1: Open the ST.ART application. 
 Step 2: Sign in as registered user 
 Step 3: Slide to the left on a performance 
 Step 4: Click Edit button 
 Step 5: Enter the updated information about the performance 
 Step 6: Click Update button 
 
 Delete performance: 
 Step 1: Open the ST.ART application. 
 Step 2: Sign in as registered user 
 Step 3: Slide to the left on a performance 
 Step 4: Click Delete button
